pr_title: [BEAM-7003 BEAM-8639 BEAM-8774] Update Kafka dependencies, enable IT test in Postcommit

timeline.message: Remove the hack to use 2.1.0 version of kafka clients in io/kafka
[BEAM-8639 BEAM-8774] Update kafka_2.11 from 1.0.0 to 2.4.1 and kafka-clients to 2.6.0
[BEAM-8639 BEAM-8774] Update Kafka dependencies and add tests for the previous versions
[BEAM-7003 BEAM-8639 BEAM-8774] Update Kafka dependencies and add tests for the previous versions
[BEAM-7003 BEAM-8639 BEAM-8774] Update Kafka dependencies and add tests for the previous versions

timeline.bodyText: Will it require to include all these different Kafka client version jars into regular build as deps?
timeline.author: aromanenko-dev
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -65,26 +76,68 @@ dependencies {
   testCompile library.java.junit
   testCompile library.java.powermock
   testCompile library.java.powermock_mockito
+  testCompile library.java.testcontainers_kafka
   testRuntimeOnly library.java.slf4j_jdk14
   testRuntimeOnly project(path: ":runners:direct-java", configuration: "shadow")
-  kafkaVersion210 "org.apache.kafka:kafka-clients:2.1.0"
+  kafkaVersions.each {"kafkaVersion$it.key" "org.apache.kafka:kafka-clients:$it.value"}

replies.bodyText:
It should do the same what kafkaVersion210 did. I've imported KafkaIO 2.25 jar and I can't see kafka-clients 2.1.0 in the dependencies. So I don't think so.
I'm not sure how to import a jar to Gradle locally, I will try it out on Monday.
replies.author: piotr-szuberski

replies.bodyText:
Could you try to build and publish KafkaIO jar with this command:
./gradlew -Ppublishing -PdistMgmtSnapshotsUrl=/path/to/.m2/repository/ -p sdks/java/io/kafka publishToMavenLocal

and check out which Kafka clients deps it comtains?
replies.author: aromanenko-dev

replies.bodyText:
That's super useful! Thank you!
I can't see any Kafka clients in the created jar.  I created a new project that uses the local repo:
repositories {
    mavenLocal()
}

dependencies {
    compile group: 'org.apache.beam', name: 'beam-sdks-java-io-kafka', version: '2.27.0-SNAPSHOT'
    testCompile group: 'org.apache.beam', name: 'beam-sdks-java-io-kafka', version: '2.27.0-SNAPSHOT'
}


Here is the output of dependencies task

replies.author: piotr-szuberski

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I missed the request for logging the Kafka version. I'm working on it now.
replies.author: piotr-szuberski

timeline.bodyText: I think this task was used to run KafkaIO unit tests against specific client version. It's not a case now?
timeline.author: aromanenko-dev

replies.bodyText:
This task is still there at
kafkaVersions.each {kv ->
  task "kafkaVersion${kv.key}Test"(type: Test)
  [...]

Though I used 2.1.1 version - is 2.1.0 special for some reason?
replies.author: piotr-szuberski

replies.bodyText: I think it should fine since 2.1.0 was used as a minimum version where headers were added (if I'm not mistaken).
replies.author: aromanenko-dev

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure as well but I guess so. I'm having a difficulty with the recently added Kafka streaming performance tests so  I'm changing this PR to WIP.
If I understand correctly these streaming tests can't be run on DirectRunner? They never stop on both direct and flink even with readTimeout set to 1min
replies.author: piotr-szuberski

replies.bodyText:
Kafka performance tests have been failing (timeout) since #13282 merge.
I guess this PR should wait until it's fixed?
https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PerformanceTests_Kafka_IO/
replies.author: piotr-szuberski

replies.bodyText: @boyuanzz Could you take a look on https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PerformanceTests_Kafka_IO/1563/ ? After rebase with latest KafkaIOIT changes, It fails because of timeout.
replies.author: aromanenko-dev

replies.bodyText: It seems like the sdk docker image is cleaned up incorrectly before test finishes. I can have a quick fix for that.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: So the problem is introduced by https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13283/files
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: @boyuanzz Thanks! I guess it's should fixed now (#13356 ), right?
replies.author: aromanenko-dev
